page.title: 13GEORGE JEFFERYS (1645-1689)
page.content: George Jefferys, 1st Baron Jefferys of Wem was born at Acton, Wrexham, on 15th May 1645 the sixth son of John Jefferys and his wife Margaret. His grandfather John Jefferys, chief Justice of Anglesey Circuit of Great Sessions, who had first adopted the family surname, laid down the foundation for the Acton Estate. George Jefferys legal career began as Common Serjeant he became solicitor general to the Duke of York.(The future James II). He was knighted in 1677 and in 1680 became Chief Justice of the Chester Circuit. By supporting the King he became Lord Chief Justice and Priry Councillor and in 1685 he became a Peer and Lord Chancellor. He surrendered the Great Seal in November 1688. In April 1689 he died in prison at the age of 44.
